title: problem accessing a page
content:
I have recently updated to Firefox 100. I am now getting this message on a page "You are using an outdated browser. Please upgrade your browser." I have confirmed I am up to date.

The "update you browser" has a link to "whatbrowser.org", which I believe is run by that horrid business, Google.

Has anyone struck this problem? Is there a solution?

I have closed Firefox & re-opened, I have rebooted the computer. No change.
creator: bosun29

title: Unable to use sync in new Windows User account with new email
content:
Hello!

I was using this laptop for everything for a few years. Now I wanted to use this for work also. Previously all my bookmarks and logins were synced via a single email account. It was easy to use across all devices. Now since I want to use this for my work also, I decided to segregate my work stuff to a new windows account. So I created a new windows account. Obviously Firefox created a new profile and it was clean. No problems there.

So I wanted to use my original email for this new windows account and new firefox profile to sync across devices. So I created a new email, added it to my firefox account, made it the primary email then deleted my original email from that firefox account so that I can use it to sync firefox in my work user account.

But, Firefox is not allowing me to. There is no "signup" option for sync. Only "sign in". It continually asked me to sign in from my primary account, so I had to sign in from my primary account to make this post. Doesnt firefox offer 2 different "sync profiles" for the same device? Or Am I doing something wrong? Please help.
creator: axmurdereryahoo

title: Top Sites missing
content:
I updated Firefox today to 100.1.1. My previous version may have been a year old. "Top Sites" on the homepage has disappeared. I can still choose "Add to top sites" from the menu, but cannot see the results of those taps, old sites or newly added sites. The rest of my bookmarks are intact...assuming there is any connection between the two. Is there a low level trick to bring them back, or is this a bug?

I noticed a very similar thread from 2020, but with no resolution:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1301109
creator: tao101

title: only firefox printing too large on windows 11

creator: joebarrelli

title: Multi Account Containers doesn't detect Mozilla VPN
content:
Firefox 100.0 Ubuntu 22.04 Mozilla VPN 2.8.0

As the title says, Multi-Account containers doesn't detect the VPN, which means that it's not setting the VPN for specific containers.

I suspect this is actually a problem with the "Allow extension to exchange messages with programs other than Firefox" permission. Could be a VPN issue, but gut feeling that it's a Firefox issue, TBH

Anyone else seeing this?
creator: barefootlance

title: My links!
content:
I was trying to solve a hanging issue with firefox and following a 'tip' I changed the name of places.sq.lite to places.sq.lite.old I figured the renamed file would be there to back-up from if something went wrong and although the hanging issue seems to have been fixed I have lost hundreds of links that have taken ages to put together.

Where is sq.lite.old located as it is missing from the original folder? It is not in my recycle bin so renaming it to old hasn't simply deleted it. In another folder there are bookmark backups with dates (JSONLZ4 files) but I have no idea how to get my old links back from them, if indeed that is what they are for.

Please help.
creator: martinsphotoart

title: PR_CONNECT_RESET_ERROR
content: Hi everyone ! I am having trouble in accessing the internet through Firefox. Other browsers on my computer works, only firefox is having this error. I am not sure what may have caused this. I access the internet through WiFi, I don't use VPN and didn't change the DNS settings. I have also updated to the latest version of firefox, but this error still persists. In the screenshot, I was trying to access youtube.com, but this error persists on any other websites that I try to access including mozilla.org. Please let me know how to fix this error. Thank you !

title: Youtube with servere lag
content:
Watching some YouTube videos recently, usually posted within the past few days, would make the website run extremely slowly. Disabling my extensions and removing them did not help make things go faster at all. (Ad Block-The best ad blocker, Ad block plus, Honey, and Reddit Enhancement Suite)

Running Firefox in troubleshoot mode seems to make them work smoothly, refreshing Firefox didn't do anything to fix it.

YouTube works on other Browsers like edge and Chrome. This is only a problem that I started to have today.
creator: nopen697

title: Firefox 11 too slow for uploads
content:
Since Firefox 11 installed onto my PC, I get about 15 instances of Firefox running in Task Manager, and uploads onto a podcast website are impossibly slow so that I am timed out from podcast website. Short video upload onto FB takes an hour now via Firefox11. The "Performance" fix has no 1-8 option anymore, unchecking "Use recommended settings" does nothing. Any solutions to suggest?

Processor 11th Gen Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-11700 @ 2.50GHz 2.50 GHz Installed RAM 32.0 GB (31.7 GB usable) System type 64-bit operating system, x64-based processor Edition Windows 11 Version 21H2 OS build 22000.613
creator: billjomes
